1.「ガハハハハッ。よう 魔法戦士団。| 例の魔物の件だが 朗報だぞ。: Gahahahahaha. Hey, Armamentalist Corps. I have|good news about that monster.

3.「タップペンギーを 棲息地から| 遠く はなれた場所で目撃し 後をつけて| やつ: We saw Pogoin' Penguin in a place far from its|habitat and followed it to a cave where they|congregated.

4.「そこは 彼らが暮らすには| まったく 適していない場所です。| 自然に そこへ: It is a completely unsuitable place for them|to live. There is no way they would naturally|move there.

5.「……ということだ。どう見る？ 魔法戦士団。: ...that's what I'm talking about. How do you|see it? Armament[...]

6.「魔物を動かした なんらかの要因があると| 言いたいのか ザイナー？: Are you suggesting that there's some kind of|factor that moved the monster, Zeiner?

7.「かもしれん。本格的に調査を始めたい。| たまには 魔法戦士団も| オレらの仕事: Maybe. I'd like to start a full-scale|investigation. Maybe the Armamentalist Corps|would like to join us for a change.

8.「ここは <pc>を行かせましょう。| 適任かと 思われます。: Let's let <pc> go here. It seems to|be the right choice.

9.「……お前らに 手伝う気があるなら| ジュレリア地下廃坑の 水環の間へ来い。|: ...If you are willing to help, come to the|Water Circle in the Juleria Underground Mine.|Noran will go with you from the Guard.

10.「誰も来なくても 調査は 開始するからな。| 言いたいことは以上だ。失礼するぞ！: We'll start the investigation even if no one|shows up. That's all I have to say. Excuse me!

11.「<pc>。話は聞いていたな？| この報告 気になるのは 確かだ。| 貴公に 任: <pc>. You've heard the stories,|haven't you? I'm sure you're anxious to hear|this report. I'll have you go on a mission.

12.「タップペンギーの 異常行動の| 原因を 突きとめてくるのだ。| これは調査任務: You are to determine the cause of Pogoin'|Penguin's erratic behavior. This is an|investigative mission. Will you do it?

13.「今回の任務は 私も同行しよう。| なんらかの 手がかりが得られたら| すぐに: I will accompany you on this mission. As soon|as we get any clues, we must decide what to do|next.

14.「ジュレー島の ジュレリア地下廃坑へ潜入。| 水環の間を見つけだし 調査を開始せ: Sneak into the Juleria Underground Mine on|Jule Island. Find the Water Circle and begin|your investigation.

15.「む……。どうやら 貴公は| 多くの任務を 抱えているようだな。: It seems that you have a lot of duties to|perform.

16.「魔法戦士は ひとつの任務に| 集中できる状態を 保たねばならない。| 他の任務: The armamentalist must remain focused on one|mission. Go and fulfill your other duties.

17.「……それは 困ったな。| 他の魔法戦士は 他国へ出払っていて| 頼める者が い: Well, that's a problem. The other|armamentalists are away in other countries and|there is no one I can ask.

18.「……まだ そんなこと言ってるの？: Are you still talking like that?

20.「……いいかげん 魔法戦士になる決心を| つけたら どうなの？: Why don't you make up your mind to become an|armamentalist?

21.「何度も言ってるだろ。| オレは 魔法戦士になる気はない。: I've said it many times. I have no intention|of becoming an armamentalist.

22.「小さいときの約束……。| ふたりで 魔法戦士になろうって……| 忘れたわけじゃ: You didn't forget our promise when we were|little that we would both become|armamentalists, did you?

23.「その話は もうやめてくれ ユナティ。| それよりも 調査任務を始めよう。| タ: Let's not talk about it anymore, Unaty.|Instead, let's get on with the research|mission. Pogoin' Penguin is in the back here.

24.「遅かったな <pc>。| ……貴公。今の話を 聞いていたか？<yesno><c: Too late <pc>. ...you. Did you hear|what I just said?<yesno><close>.

25.「……まあいい。もし 何か| 聞いたのならば 忘れることだ。: Well, that's okay. If you heard something,|forget it.

27.「貴様 何者だ？ ここで 何をしている！？: Who are you? What are you doing here?

28.「へいっ らっしぇい！！| ……って なんでぇ 客じゃねえみてーだな？: Hey, there, guys! Why do you look like you're|not a customer?

29.「私は ヴェリナード王立魔法戦士団| 副団長のユナティである。: I am Unaty, Sub Leader Unaty of the Royal|Armamentalist Corps of Verinard.

30.「魔法戦士団……？ てめぇらかあ！| うちの商品ナンバー３を 壊しまくってんのは: Armamentalist Corps...? You guys! You're the|ones destroying our number 3 product! You're|ruining our customer's reputation!

31.「まさか……。この魔物たちを| よその国に 売っているのか？: Don't tell me... you are selling these|monsters to other countries?

32.「おうよ。魔物を調教して 売りさばくのよ。| わしゃあ ザルギスってモンだ。|: Oh, yeah. We train monsters and sell them. I|am Zarugisu. Call me a monster trader!

33.「しかしなあ……。この倉庫を見つけられちゃあ| 商売上がったりだよなあ。| てめ: But, you know... if they find this warehouse,|it's bad for business, isn't it? I'll just|have to let them die.

34.「新商品のナンバー７を 試させてもらうぜ。| 出荷準備も整って バリバリの売れ筋: I'm going to try out the new Item Number 7.|It's ready to ship, and it's selling like|hotcakes. I hope you like it. Kihi...

35.「わしゃあ 伝票を書かなきゃいかんから| 先に 帰らせてもらうぜい。: I have to fill out a form, so I'm going home|first.

36.「あいつは 私が追います！| ここを お願いしますっ。: I'll go after him! Here, please.

37.「<cs_pchero>！ 貴公は 魔物の相手を頼む。| 私は ノーランの援護に: <cs_pchero>! You deal with the monsters. I'm|going to cover Noran!

39.「<cs_pchero> どこへ行っていた？| この魔物たちの相手を 頼んだはず: <cs_pchero> Where have you been? I thought I|asked you to deal with these monsters.

40.「ノーランが 魔物商人ザルギスを追っている。| 私は その援護に行かなくてはなら: Noran is in pursuit of the monster trader|Zarugisu. I have to go cover for him. I'll|leave this to you!

42.「よくやった <cs_pchero>。| 魔物の群れは 討伐したようだな。: Well done <cs_pchero>. Looks like you took|down a bunch of monsters.

43.「だが すまない。| 魔物商人ザルギスは 逃してしまったのだ。: But I'm sorry. Zarugisu, the monster merchant,|had been missed.

44.「衛士ノーラン！ なぜ 私が追いつくまで| ザルギスを 足止めできなかったのだ！: Guard Noran! Why didn't you manage to stop|Zarugisu in his tracks before I caught up with|him!

45.「申し訳ありません。追いつめはしたのですが| ザルギスが 新たな魔物を呼びだし…: My apologies. I was able to catch up with him,|but Zarugisu called up a new monster, and I|had a hard time dealing with it.

46.「……今から追っても 間に合うまい。| この一連の事件が あの男のしわざだと|:
We'll never get to him in time, even if we|start chasing him now. It's a good thing that|we know that this series of incidents were|
|caused by that man.

47.「待ってください。あの男は 逃げる際に| 手がかりとなる言葉を 残していきました: Wait a minute. That man left a clue in his|escape.

48.「ふむ……。ならば それを| アーベルク団長の前で 報告してほしい。| 我々は: Well... then, I would like you to report it in|front of Commander Aberuku. We need to take|immediate action.

49.「……わかりました。| 後ほど アーベルク団長に 報告に参ります。: I will report back to Commander Aberg later. I|will report to Commander Aberuku later.

50.「<cs_pchero> ご苦労だった。| 残念な点はあったが 調査任務は終わり:
Thank you for your efforts. I am|sorry for your disappointment, but your|investigative mission is over. Return to|
|Verinard Castle and come[...]

51.「衛士ノーラン ジュレリア地下廃坑| 水環の間の調査報告に 参りました。: Guard Noran, I am here to report on the|investigation of the Juleria Underground Mine|Water Circle Mine.

52.「ご苦労。貴公は 魔物商人ザルギスが| 逃げる際の言葉を 聞いたそうだな。| 一: Thank you. You heard the words of Zarugisu,|the monster trader, when he escaped. You must|tell us every word of it.

53.「はい。ザルギスは なんらかの地下組織に| 商品ナンバー７と呼ぶ ウェナ諸島の魔:
Yes, sir. It appears that Zarugisu has sold a|large number of monsters from the Wena|Islands, which he calls Item Number 7, to some|
|sort of underground organization.

54.「オーグリード大陸での 取り引きの予定が近い。| その準備に追われている……と言: He said that he was very close to a deal to do|business in Ogreed Continent. We are busy with|the preparations..." he said.

55.「なるほど……。そのせいで| うかつに 姿を見せたということか。: I see... so that's why he carelessly showed|himself.

56.「その魔物が 大挙して 暴れることがあれば| 国際問題となるは 必至か。| 魔法:
If these monsters were to run rampant, it|would inevitably become an international|problem. We must summon the armamentalist|
|warriors and take countermeasures.

57.「それは この国を守るため……ですか？: Is it to protect this country?

58.「この国を守るのは 衛士団の役目ではないか。| 我々には 国外で起こる事件を|:
Isn't it the role of the Guard to protect this|country? We have the important task of|preventing incidents from happening outside|
|the country.

59.「魔法戦士団は オーグリード大陸に飛び| 取り引き現場を 押さえにいくのだ。: Armamentalist Corps flew to Ogreed Continent|to seize the scene of the deal.

60.「……失礼しました。| 衛士団は ザルギスの行方を追います。: ...my apologies. The Guard will pursue|Zarugisu's whereabouts.

61.「ノーランめ 相変わらずか。| そういえば 貴公は ノーランのことを| よく 知: Noran, as usual. Come to think of it, you|don't know much about Noran, do you?

62.「……かつて 魔法戦士団にとって| 最大の任務と呼ばれる ひどい事件があった。|:
There was once a terrible incident called the|Armamentalist Corps' greatest mission.|Monsters organized themselves and attacked|
|towns all over the world.

63.「その時は このヴェリナードも標的となり| あるひとつの町が 魔物に壊滅させられ: Verinard was the target, and one town was|destroyed by the monsters. It was Noran's|hometown.

64.「やつの母は その事件で亡くなり……。| 魔法戦士だった父は 任務で他の国にいて:
His mother died in the incident and his|father, an armamentalist, was in another|country on a mission and unable to help his|
|family.

65.「ノーランは 死なずに済んだが| この出来事が あやつの| 魔法戦士になる決心を: Noran may have survived, but the incident has|soured his resolve to become an armamentalist.

66.「<pc>。任務 ご苦労だった。| 私は 他の魔法戦士に連絡を取り| 取り引きを: <pc>. Thank you for your service. I|will have to contact the other armamentalists|and work out a way to prevent a deal.

67.「しばらく 時間がほしい。| 貴公は さらに 優美たる魔法戦士を目指し| 修行を: I need some time. You must continue your|training to become a more graceful|armamentalist.
